sources.title: Call Northside 777 (1948)
sources.description: In 1932, a cop is killed and Frank Wiecek sentenced to life. Eleven years later, a newspaper ad by Frank's mother leads Chicago reporter P.J. O'Neal to look into the case. For some time, O'Neal continues to believe Frank guilty. But when he starts to change his mind, he meets increased resistance from authorities unwilling to be proved wrong. Watch on RetroFlix.org: https://retroflix.org/call-northside-777-1948/

sources.title: Call Northside 777 (1948) [720p High Res.] James Stewart, Richard Conte, Lee J. Cobb
sources.description: Call Northside 777 is a 1948 reality-based FILM NOlR newspaper docu-drama directed by Henry Hathaway. It stars James Stewart, Richard Conte and Lee J. Cobb.   The film parallels the true story of a Chicago reporter who proved that a man jailed for murder was wrongly convicted 11 years before. James Stewart stars as the persistent journalist and Richard Conte plays the imprisoned Frank Wiecek. Wiecek is based on Joseph Majczek, who was wrongly convicted of the murder of a Chicago policeman in 1932, one of the worst years of organized crime during Prohibition.   You can find out more about this movie from Wikipedia and there is also a review from the movie blog D for Doom .

sources.title: Call Northside 777 (restored, with intro and outro commentary) (1948, film noir, imdb score: 7.4)
sources.description: Call Northside 777 is a 1948 American drama film directed by Henry Hathaway . The film parallels the true story of a Chicago newspaper reporter who proved that a man jailed for murder 11 years previously was wrongly convicted. James Stewart stars as the persistent journalist and Richard Conte plays the imprisoned Frank Wiecek. Wiecek is based on Joseph Majczek , who was wrongly convicted of the murder of a Chicago policeman in 1932, one of the worst years of organized crime during prohibition.

metadata.Plot: In 1932, a cop is killed and Frank Wiecek sentenced to life. Eleven years later, a newspaper ad by Frank's mother leads Chicago reporter P.J. McNeal to look into the case. For some time, McNeal continues to believe Frank guilty. But when he starts to change his mind, he meets increased resistance from authorities unwilling to be proved wrong.
metadata.Writer: Jerome Cady, Jay Dratler, Leonard Hoffman
metadata.Actors: James Stewart, Richard Conte, Lee J. Cobb
